part.content: PART I : RELEVANCY OF FACTS Sec. 1 - 55.
CHAPTER I. PRELIMINARY. Sec. 1 - 4.
CHAPTER II. OF THE RELEVANCY OF FACTS. Sec. 5 - 55.
Admissions. Sec. 17 - 31.
Statements by persons who cannot be called as witnesses. Sec. 32 - 33.
Statements made under special circumstances. Sec. 34 - 38.
How much of a statement is - be proved. Sec. 39.
Judgments of Courts of Justice, when relevant . Sec. 40 - 44.
Opinions of third persons, when relevant. Sec. 45 - 51.
Character when relevant. Sec. 52 - 55.
PART II : ON PROOF. Sec. 56 - 100.
CHAPTER III. FACTS WHICH NEED NOT BE PROVED. Sec.56 - 58.
CHAPTER IV. OF ORAL EVIDENCE. Sec. 59 - 60.
CHAPTER V. OF DOCUMENTARY EVIDENCE. Sec. 61 - 73A.
Public documents. Sec. 74 - 78.
Presumptions as - documents. Sec. 79 - 90A.
CHAPTER VI. OF THE EXCLUSION OF ORAL BY DOCUMENTARY EVIDENCE. Sec. 91 - 100.
PART III : PRODUCTION AND EFFECT OF EVIDENCE. Sec. 101 - 167.
CHAPTER VII. OF THE BURDEN OF PROOF. Sec. 101 - 114A.
CHAPTER VIII. ES-PPEL. Sec. 115 - 117.
CHAPTER IX. OF WITNESSES. Sec. 118 - 134.
CHAPTER X. OF THE EXAMINATION OF WITNESSES. Sec. 135 - 166.
CHAPTER XI. OF IMPROPER ADMISSION AND REJECTION OF EVIDENCE. Sec. 167.
